articles.title: Mint explainer | How $600 million changed hands, but PhonePe saw none
articles.description: General Atlantic invested $600 million, but no new money came into PhonePe, and neither the founders nor employees took cash off the table.
articles.content:
No new money came into the company, and neither the founders nor employees took cash off the table, they added.
This isn’t a routine move, especially for a company gearing up for an ₹11,000-12,000 crore initial public offering (IPO), said experts.

articles.title: Akbani to lead NVCC; CA Sarda becomes Secy
articles.description: setting aside their differences, the two main factions of the nag vidarbha chamber of commerce (nvcc) on thursday joined hands to elect the new team of office-bearers for 2025-26 term. the region’s leading body of traders unanimously elected farooq akbani and ca hemant sarda as the new president and secretary at its 81st annual general body meeting held at rajwada palace, near gandhi sagar in the city.
articles.content:
Business Reporter :

articles.title: Dhaliwal’s efforts put Punjab on national basketball map
articles.description: As general secretary of PBA, he played crucial role in promoting sport.
articles.content:
Teja Singh Dhaliwal is a prominent figure in the Indian sports arena, particularly in basketball. As the general secretary of the Punjab Basketball Association (PBA), Dhaliwal has played a crucial role in promoting the sport in the region.

articles.title: Haryana IPS officer’s suicide: Procedural gaps in Rohtak FIR against cop raise questions
articles.description: The FIR registered at Rohtak’s Urban Estate police station at 3.59 pm on October 6 names Sushil Kumar, an exemptee assistant sub inspector (EASI), deployed with former Rohtak Range inspector general of police (IGP) Y Puran Kumar, as an accused for demanding a bribe of ₹2.5 lakh allegedly on behalf of the IPS officer.

articles.title: Committed to expanding peaceful applications of nuclear technology: India
articles.description: UNITED NATIONS, Oct 30 : India has said that it remains committed to expanding peaceful applications of nuclear technology, both in the power and non-power sectors, while ensuring the security of nuclear and radiological materials. “India has a robust nuclear safety culture and an impeccable safety record,” Member of Parliament D Purandeswari said at the 80th Session of the UN General Assembly on the Report of the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) Wednesday. Purandeswari is part of a visiting delegation […]
articles.content:

articles.title: J&K has 2,960 gazetted, 14,993 non-gazetted vacancies in 32 deptts
articles.description: 465 posts referred to JKPSC, 3,795 to JKSSB Bivek Mathur JAMMU, Oct 30: The Union Territory of Jammu and Kashmir has 2, 960 gazetted and 14, 993 non-gazetted cadre vacancies under the direct quota in 32 different departments. This information was tabled in the Legislative Assembly today in reply to an unstarred question of PDP legislator Waheed-ur-Rehman Parra by Chief Minister Omar Abdullah, who is also the Minister Incharge of the General Administration Department (GAD). “The Union Territory of Jammu […]
articles.content:

articles.title: CS directs for accelerated implementation of key rural development schemes
articles.description: *Listens issues raised by GCC Excelsior Correspondent SRINAGAR, Oct 30: Chief Secretary, Atal Dulloo, today chaired a comprehensive review meeting of the Rural Development and Panchayati Raj (RD&PR) Department to assess the progress of key flagship schemes like Pradhan Mantri Awaas Yojana-Gramin (PMAY-G), Swachh Bharat Mission-Gramin (SBM-G), and the placement-linked skill training programme Himayat (DDU-GKY). The meeting was attended by Secretary, Rural Development Department, Aijaz Asad; Director General, Rural Sanitation, Anoo Malhotra; and Managing Director, Himayat, Rajneesh Gupta, among other […]
articles.content:

articles.title: Karra, Mir welcome new entrants into Congress
articles.description: Excelsior Correspondent SRINAGAR, Oct 30: The Jammu and Kashmir Pradesh Congress Committee (JKPCC) president Tariq Hameed Karra alongwith CLP Leader and AICC general secretary Ghulam Ahmad Mir and other senior leaders and Legislators welcomed a large number of political figures into Congress. Former Minister GM Saroori led hundreds of prominent political figures from Chenab Valley joined Congress at Srinagar Party office under the leadership of JKPCC President. They expressed full faith under the pro-people policies and progrmmes of Congress, assuring […]

articles.title: Govt retains 7.1% interest rate on GPF
articles.description: Excelsior Correspondent JAMMU, Oct 30: The Finance Department has announced that the General Provident Fund (GPF) will continue to carry an interest rate of 7.1 percent for the first quarter of the financial year 2025-26, from April 1 to June 30, 2025. Follow the Daily Excelsior channel on WhatsApp As per a Government order issued by the Principal Secretary, Finance Department, Santosh D Vaidya, this rate remains unchanged from the previous quarters of 2024-25, in line with the notifications of […]
